author: madhum
msg: Replace the 'grain' with a more generic APR_ALIGN_DEFAULT. (Use of grain was
overhead when APR_ALIGN_DEFAULT is used - both end up doing the same thing)
Cause/Symptom : SIGBUS when trying to write to a "double", that was aligned
at a 4-byte boundary in the shared memory.
Solution      : Memory pointer should be aligned by 8 rather than 4.
